passage.title: The man and the penguin
passage.paragraph: One day a policeman is walking in the park. He sees a man there. The man is holding a penguin. The man says to the policeman, "I find this penguin this morning, what shall I do with it?"
"Take it to the zoo," says the policeman.
The next day the policeman sees the man again. He is still holding the penguin. The policeman says, "Why don't you take the penguin to the zoo?"
"I do," says the man. "I took it to the zoo yesterday. Today I'm asking it to the cinema."
